meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Student Guilty in Bush Plot An Arab-American student from Virginia was convicted of plotting with operatives of Al Qaeda to assassinate President Bush in a trial the Justice Department has seen as an important test.
PAGE A20

Stuffing Inventor Is Dead Ruth M. Siems, a retired home economist whose best-known innovation will make its appearance, welcome or otherwise, in millions of homes tomorrow, has died. Ms. Siems, an inventor of the Thanksgiving mainstay Stove Top stuffing, was 74.
PAGE A25

Under the Big Balloons, Safety Questions After an out-of-control balloon injured spectators at the Thanksgiving Day parade in 1997, Macy's established fitness tests and drills for its balloon handlers. But now they are guided mainly by instruction sheets.
PAGE B1

Bosnians Reach Unity Accord Leaders of Bosnia's three major ethnic groups, seeking to unify their country, pledged to overhaul their constitutional and government system for the first time since the Bosnian war ended a decade ago.
PAGE A3
Board Wants Judge Removed A state commission says a New York City judge should be removed from the bench for helping a robbery suspect elude a detective through a back door in her courtroom.
PAGE B1

Quarantine Rules Proposal Federal officials proposed the first significant changes in quarantine rules in 25 years as part of a broader Bush administration plan to improve response to disease threats.
PAGE A22

Student Guilty in Bush Plot An Arab-American student from Virginia was convicted of plotting with operatives of Al Qaeda to assassinate President Bush in a trial the Justice Department has seen as an important test.
PAGE A20

Stuffing Inventor Is Dead Ruth M. Siems, a retired home economist whose best-known innovation will make its appearance, welcome or otherwise, in millions of homes tomorrow, has died. Ms. Siems, an inventor of the Thanksgiving mainstay Stove Top stuffing, was 74.
PAGE A25

Under the Big Balloons, Safety Questions After an out-of-control balloon injured spectators at the Thanksgiving Day parade in 1997, Macy's established fitness tests and drills for its balloon handlers. But now they are guided mainly by instruction sheets.
PAGE B1

Bosnians Reach Unity Accord Leaders of Bosnia's three major ethnic groups, seeking to unify their country, pledged to overhaul their constitutional and government system for the first time since the Bosnian war ended a decade ago.
PAGE A3
Board Wants Judge Removed A state commission says a New York City judge should be removed from the bench for helping a robbery suspect elude a detective through a back door in her courtroom.
